newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Jan 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Jan 9.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
The Ministry of Internal Trade and state grain authorities call on local officials to ensure the supply of grain to China's armed forces.
The Ministry of Railways is to launch a 3.5 billion yuan ($421 million) corporate bond issue next week.
The State Planning Commission has approved the issue of about 1.1 billion yuan ($132 million) in bonds to finance development of the power industry.
Chinese courts are dealing with a rising number of cases involving intellectual property rights, but more training was needed to ensure judicial expertise and ethics.
The China Securities Regulatory Commission will handle applications from domestic and overseas securities institutes for the trading of foreign capital shares.
The Ministry of Finance will launch the redemption of state debt maturing in 1997 from next Monday.
The net profits of the Wuhan Iron and Steel Co soar by 154 percent to 700 million yuan ($84.3 million) in 1996.
Sales of Qilu Petrochemical Corp total 14.6 billion yuan ($1.76 billion) in 1996, with pre-tax profits of 3.25 billion yuan ($391 million).
Sales of personal computers in 1997 are estimated to exceed 2.25 million units, up 40 percent from 1996.
Total demand for automobiles is seen at about 1.65 million vehicles in 1997.
